sponsor.partnerMessage: Discover the perfect blend of modern banking solutions and personalized service at Generations Bank. Open an account today and experience the trusted expertise of a family-owned institution that has been serving Arkansans for over 115 years.

posts.title: Spark Your Summertime Romance At Underwoods Fine Jewelers
posts.content:
If you're dreaming of a summer proposal but feel unsure about navigating the world of engagement rings, the experienced team at Underwoods Fine Jewelers is here to help.

  • By the hand: Underwoods shares invaluable insights in their Guide To Buying An Engagement Ring, from demystifying the 4 C's of diamonds to selecting the ideal shape and metal. This comprehensive guide will help you feel more confident and make an informed decision.
  • Keep it secret: Looking to surprise your significant other? Underwoods has some clever ideas for how to learn your partner's style — even ways to figure out their ring size without ruining the element of surprise.

With a legacy dating back to 1957, Underwoods has been instrumental in crafting countless love stories. Start your own chapter by exploring their stunning collection HERE.

posts.title: Broadway Veteran Returns Home For Production Of Sweeney Todd
posts.content:
Northwest Arkansas native Coleman Ray Clark will direct the classic musical Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street at the Pat Ellison Performing Arts Center in Springdale this summer, with shows from Jul 20-23 and 27-30.

  • Homecoming: Known for his work on and off Broadway, Clark brings home an impressive theatrical background to showcase the talents of almost 100 locals cast in the show and provide learning opportunities for students engaging with the broader NWA creative community.
  • No Place Like London: Presented by Arts One Presents, Sweeney Todd follows the infamous barber as he seeks revenge in 19th-century London. It is a tale of revenge, dark humor, and unforgettable melodies.

Get your tickets on Arts One Presents' website HERE before they're gone!

posts.title: XNA Travel Numbers Soar Toward Busiest Summer Ever
posts.content:
This May, Northwest Arkansas National Airport experienced its third-busiest month in history — boding well for its busiest summer ever.

  • Heating up: June 2019 holds the record as XNA's busiest month at 91,305 passengers, but this summer may set a new high, especially after the Walmart Shareholders' events led to the two busiest days in the airport's history on Jun 2 and 3.
  • Life's a breeze: Breeze Airways experienced a soaring May, boarding over 3,000 passengers for the third month in a row, serving customers with direct flights to New Orleans, Tampa, and Orlando.

Check Fare Flight NWA for great travel resources HERE.

posts.title: Ozark Beer Co. Releases Collaboration With BlackMan Brewing Co.
posts.content:
Ozark Beer Company and BlackMan Brewing Company are excited to release two new collaboration brews during a Juneteenth celebration this Friday, Jun 16, from 5:30-7:30p.

  • Brewing abroad: World traveler and nomadic brewer Barrett Tillman founded BlackMan Brewing after years spent perfecting his craft in the Dallas beer industry. He now collaborates with existing breweries to release specialty products around the world.
  • See what it tastes like: Join the celebration this Friday to sample the session IPA and blonde ale and hear the brewers share what they learned through the months-long collaboration leading up to these new beers.

The event is free, but register to let them know you're coming HERE.

posts.title: Northwest Arkansas Shines As Destination for Nature-Based Therapy
posts.content:
Veterans from across the U.S. are discovering the healing power of Northwest Arkansas' scenic beauty as Higher Ground hosts a mountain biking retreat for veterans and their significant others in Bentonville through Jun 17.

  • Recreation heals: Idaho-based nonprofit Higher Ground specializes in recreational therapy for those with disabilities, as well as veterans and first responders coping with PTSD and other traumas.
  • Natural State: Northwest Arkansas's natural beauty and abundant outdoor opportunities make it an ideal destination for nature-based recovery groups — something local organizations like ReWild the Child and Sheep Dog Impact Assistance enjoy year-round.

Read more on the story HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• ☕ Coffee + Ambiance: Looking for a new place for a hand-crafted latte, getting some work done, or meeting a client? Look no further than the newly renovated Lambeth Lounge located inside the Inn at Carnall Hall, open daily at 7a.*
  • 🎤 Transcend genre: Whether you're a rockstar, a rap virtuoso, or a modern-day Sinatra, belt out your favorite tunes at Big Box Karaoke for an unforgettable night of music, laughter, and fun. Reserve your mic HERE.*
  • 🏥 Health journey: Witness the future of healthcare as Plug and Play presents six inspiring success stories of corporations, startups, and new ventures who are revolutionizing the industry with digital solutions for accessible and affordable care at Crystal Bridges next Tuesday, Jun 20, from 1-6:30p.
  • 🏋️ In the gym: McClure Fitness announced a new Bentonville location is on the horizon, with plans to open in late fall.
  • 🥩 Nice to meat you: Tyson Foods will celebrate Juneteenth with a protein donation at Don Tyson Parkway this Saturday, Jun 17, at 8a.
  • 📅 Local happenings: Explore upcoming events mentioned in the newsletter, or post your own HERE!
